page.title: 01Kerry Hills Sth of Anchor
page.content: The world famous Kerry Sheep are still verymuch in evidence and provide the main income, with cattle for the local farmers. The forestry plantations have been allowed to run down with subsequent loss of livelihood for local people. The nearby Anchor Inn provides a cente for local people to meet and also attracts clientele from Newtown (8ms to n/w) as well as passing tourists. Topography ranges in height from approx 820 to 1500 with rainfall of about 55 inches a year. Public transport amounts to one coach a week, on a tuesday, to Newtown for market day. About 25% of the fields have been drained and reseeded thanks to govenrment grants which have also helped with fencing,forests type farm roads and of course the subsidies for cattle and sheep has made the land a viable proposition to earn a living.
